skill.name: deep-reading-analyst
skill.description: Comprehensive framework for deep analysis of articles, papers, and long-form content using 10+ thinking models (SCQA, 5W2H, critical thinking, inversion, mental models, first principles, systems thinking, six thinking hats). Use when users want to: (1) deeply understand complex articles/content, (2) analyze arguments and identify logical flaws, (3) extract actionable insights from reading materials, (4) create study notes or learning summaries, (5) compare multiple sources, (6) transform knowledge into practical applications, or (7) apply specific thinking frameworks. Triggered by phrases like 'analyze this article,' 'help me understand,' 'deep dive into,' 'extract insights from,' 'use [framework name],' or when users provide URLs/long-form content for analysis.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, filesystem access, network calls, or external dependencies. Contains only markdown documentation and analytical frameworks.

content.user_title: Analyze articles with structured thinking frameworks
content.value_statement: Transform complex articles into clear insights using proven thinking models. Systematically evaluate arguments, identify logical gaps, and extract actionable knowledge from any reading material.
actual_capabilities: Apply 10+ thinking frameworks (SCQA, 5W2H, critical thinking, inversion, mental models)
Evaluate argument quality and identify logical fallacies
Extract core insights from articles, papers, and long-form content
Compare multiple sources and synthesize perspectives
Generate structured learning notes with action items
Identify information gaps and assess source credibility
limitations: Does not access external URLs or files directly (relies on provided content)
Analysis quality depends on the quality and completeness of source material
Cannot verify claims against live data or current events
Framework selection requires user guidance for optimal results

use_cases.title: Academic paper analysis
use_cases.description: Extract core arguments and evidence from research papers for study notes and literature reviews.

use_cases.title: Business document evaluation
use_cases.description: Analyze strategy articles, reports, and whitepapers to inform decisions and identify risks.

use_cases.title: Knowledge extraction
use_cases.description: Transform blog posts, essays, and books into actionable insights for personal growth.

prompt_templates.title: Quick analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this article using SCQA framework. Extract the Situation, Complication, Question, and Answer. Identify the top 3 insights.

prompt_templates.title: Critical review
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply critical thinking to this content. Evaluate evidence quality, identify logical fallacies, and assess argument strength (1-10).

prompt_templates.title: Deep analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a deep analysis using multiple frameworks: First Principles to identify core assumptions, Inversion to find failure modes, and Mental Models from 3 different disciplines.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-source synthesis
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare this article with 2 related sources. Create a comparison matrix showing consensus, divergence, and synthesized insights.

output_examples.input: Analyze this article about remote work productivity using multiple frameworks.
output: SCQA Summary: Situation (remote tech mature) â†’ Complication (productivity concerns) â†’ Question (how to maintain productivity?) â†’ Answer (clear policies, training, culture)
Key Insight 1: Manager training on async communication is critical
Key Insight 2: Culture building requires intentional virtual social mechanisms
Risk: Cybersecurity threats increase with distributed teams
Action: Implement 30-day pilot with clear success metrics

best_practices: Start with the user's goal (learning, decision-making, writing) to select appropriate frameworks
Use Level 1 (15min) for quick checks, Level 3 (60min) for comprehensive analysis
Always end with actionable takeaways tied to the user's specific context
anti_patterns: Applying all frameworks at once instead of selecting based on purpose
Copying text verbatim instead of rewording for understanding
Skipping the clarification questions about goal and depth preference

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works with all content types including articles, papers, and reports.

faq.question: How long does analysis take?
faq.answer: Four levels available: Quick (15min), Standard (30min), Deep (60min), and Research (120min+). Choose based on content complexity.

faq.question: Can it analyze URLs?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes content you provide. For URL analysis, use web search tools to fetch content first, then apply this skill.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution, file access, or network calls. Analysis happens entirely through the AI model.

faq.question: Why choose frameworks over simple summary?
faq.answer: Frameworks reveal deeper structure: logical gaps, hidden assumptions, risks, and cross-domain insights that summaries miss.

faq.question: How does this differ from general Q&A?
faq.answer: Systematic framework application ensures consistent, thorough analysis. Each model reveals different dimensions of content.
